page.title: 01Chatteris:An Overall View
page.content: Chatteris is a small town in the fens with a population of 6180. It is a fen island surrounded by very fertile peaty farmland suitable for growing root and cereal crops and is particularly famous for the growing of carrots. Much of the surrounding land lies at or below sea level. To the west of the town the landscape appears very flat and there are few trees and bushes. Drainage is important. Several of the town's industries are connected with agriculture, such as vegetable packing and haulage.There are also other light industries such as the engineering works of Stainless Metalcraft. The main industrial areas are in the north and west of the town. At present a new network of roads is being planned and built in the area which will help communications with the midlands, north and south.
